column1: back of a length, at off stump, defended to cover
he's off the mark in style, latches onto a short ball and pulls it in the air over square leg
pitches fuller, pushed into the covers and he sets off but gets sent back. A wise move from Finch
back of a length, outside off, 141kph/87mph, defended towards backward point
tight line at off stump, short of a length, dropped just off the pitch with soft hands and this is a well-judged run
angles a length delivery into the pads, deflects to the on side
short of a length, straight, tucked into midwicket
that's a beauty! Angled across just outside off stump, zips past the outside edge and lovely carry to Buttler
beats him again! Warner feeling for this one away from his body without any footwork. Hint of seam movememt
fuller at off stump, pushed just to the left of mid-on
he's crunched that! Short outside off, he fetches it and pulls powerfully through straight midwicket
short of a length at off stump, pulled off the hip to long leg
short of a length at off stump, behind the line and defends to the covers
gets inside the line and works a short-of-a-length delivery off the pads to long leg
another rasping pull shot...he looks in great form again. Short outside off, but not that short, and he pulls it in front of square
fuller at off stump, closes the face and works through the leg side
back of a length at off stump, 143kph, defended back to the bowler
leading edge, but safe! Looking to work this into the leg side, closes the face a touch early, it flies fine of gully
full outside off, left alone
in the channel outside off, 141kph, through to the keeper
gets forward into a good length ball and defends to cover
short of a length, angled in at the pads, gets inside the line and works to long leg
goes for the yorker, on target, dug out into the covers...Woakes looking better today
short of a length outside off, punched from the back foot to cover
full at off stump, driven firmly towards mid-on and he sets off straightaway...Woakes throws at the striker's end, but Warner well home
at middle and off, fuller, defended
full at leg stump, takes the pad as Warner falls across it a touch
short outside leg stump, Warner ducks...143kph

lovely piece of timing and placement, presses forward to a full delivery outside off and slots it between point and cover...is that a brilliant flick back on the rope by Roy? They'll check this. Given four
full, angled in at off stump, defended to the bowler
worked off the pads behind square on the leg side
good length at middle and off, no width to work with, pushed towards mid-off and he's again keen for the single
takes advantage of a fuller delivery, drills it straight down the ground...stand and deliver
back of a length outside off, cut into the covers
tight line, middle and off, 137kph and defended to the on side
short of a length at off stump, 141kph, flicked towards midwicket
this one is fuller, angled in at the stumps, pushed towards mid-on
nicely bowled, full at off stump, 142kph, just a hint of it straightening on Finch and it takes a thickish outside edge into backward point
full outside off, played from reasonably deep in the crease, push and run towards mid-off
bang! Full outside off, he doesn't bother with footwork, just swings through the line and clubs it straight down the ground
this time it's a short ball, doesn't hurry the batsman, Warner pulls over square leg
three boundaries in a row, Finch this time as he takes advantage of a short-of-a-length delivery and pulls through midwicket
there's a strangled appeal for a catch down the leg side, but this glances the thigh pad on the way to Buttler
plays back and flicks to deep midwicket off one leg
full at off stump, a slower delivery at 123kph, pushed off the front foot to mid-off
full and straight, a bottom-handed whip to mid-on, another slower one bowled as an off-cutter
walks into a drive but picks out the man at cover on the edge of the circle
starts with a straight delivery, good length, tucked towards short fine leg

That's a stolen two! Good length outside off, played with an open face to backward point, Roy throws at the non-striker's end, hits direct and it deflects away for a brace even though it remained inside the circle
nudged off the hip behind square
that's the wrong line, outside leg stump, flicked away very fine
back on off stump, fuller, pushed into point
a solid push off the front foot finds mid-off
looks to work a straight ball to the leg side but this takes the pads
presses forward and plays back to the bowler
flicks a slightly shorter delivery to deep square leg
pushed in quite quickly, at leg stump, pushed into midwicket
short of a length at off stump, can't find the gap as he drives to cover
fuller at the stumps, worked towards short fine leg...excellent start from Moeen
full at off stump, 136mph, pushed to the covers
down the leg side, Warner misses his flick but he'll get that ball again
well bowled, a touch slower at 133kph, beats Warner's inside edge as he looks to work to the leg side, takes the pads into backward point
full at leg stump, flicked to long leg
just over mid-on! Aiming to drive down the ground, for a second looked as though he'd picked out Woakes, but he got enough leverage to clear his leap
drags the length back, worked into midwicket
a length ball outside off, driven to deep cover
worked off the stumps into square leg...Warner pushes for a second but it's not on
flicks a straight delivery to deep square leg
dragged down short outside off, mistimed through backward point but gets back for the second
edged, taken! Lovely stuff from Moeen. This is tighter to off stump, Warner looking to push into the off side, takes an outside edge and snaffled at slip
plays back to a shortish ball outside off, pushed to the covers
slides into the pads, flicked around the corner...actually no bat, just thigh pad
full at middle and leg, pushed to mid-on.
full toss outside leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
goes for the sweep to a ball sliding down the leg side, gets the wide call
flicked to midwicket
that's high and handsome! A full delivery, Finch stays in the crease, and lofts it cleanly straight down the ground over long-on
shorter, flatter, nudged behind square on the leg side and that's excellent running to make the second
props forward to a full delivery and defends
taken from outside off down the ground to long-on
good length outside off, hint of turn, defended to the on side
shorter and straighter, worked through square leg
short of a length outside off, finds short third man with an open face
very full this time, dug out to cover
bottom hand comes into play as he reaches out and flicks this from quite wide outside off down to long-on
he's down the pitch and that's over the rope...didn't go as far as Finch's, but comfortably clears the long-on rope. They are after Rashid
full and straight, pushed to midwicket
full outside leg stump, givens himself a touch of room and pushes along the ground to long-on
defeats him with the googly! Brings an lbw appeal. They ponder the review but decline. Just did too much I think. Umpire's call on hitting
a firm sweep from outside leg, whistles to deep square leg
push just wide of Rashid as he dives in his follow through and cover can't get across to save the single
full and straight, driven to long-on
dragged down short but Finch misses out as he pulls to short fine leg
an appeal for a tickle down the leg side, neat take from Buttler, but it's not out...took the pad
worked to deep midwicket
full outside off, drives to cover
this one turns from back of a length, tapped square into the off side...nice stuff from Moeen
nudged off the pads through square leg
sweeps from outside leg stump and finds short fine leg
moves outside leg stump, pushed into the covers
touch more air, fuller and middle and leg, hint of turn and defended
short and a hint of width outside off, good work at short third man as Finch cuts
this is a short one but only costs a single as he pull/sweeps to deep square leg
sliding down the leg-side, Finch lines up the sweep but can't connect
bat on ball this time, a rolling sweep to backward square
clipped into the gap at square leg, they push hard and turn for the second
stepping outside off to nurdle another single to leg
tucked to the leg side
flicked hard out to deep midwicket, they gallop the first but don't risk turning for another
attacking the tramlines on a full length outside off, but just a tick too far outside off for the umpire's liking
punched firmly to short cover

England are very interested in this one and go up for the review. Very full length, flicking the top of the pad outside off, and was there an inside edge? Nope, it was front pad then back pad. On we go
a thumping drive out to deep cover
swivel-pulled out to the leg side, and up comes Finch's fifty. Another fine knock, to follow his Melbourne hundred. And he's going at a quicker tempo too
tapped to third man, through they jog
width, and cut through backward point
whipped off the pads, round the corner
back of a length, a touch of turn, Finch works with the spin to tick off another single to leg
angled into the leg side

huge appeal and Smith is pinned lbw! Unsurprisingly, he has reviewed... he was stretching onto the front foot, might it have hit him outside the line? Nope, that is trimming the top of the leg bail and what a breakthrough!
round the wicket, outside off, pushed to cover
leaning forward, tidied up at cover
onto the front foot, pushed back to the bowler
deflected into the leg side, another sharp single
good tight wicket-to-wicket line, defended on the crease-line
sweetly drilled to mid-on
tapped to point
firmly driven, beats the diving short cover, but tidied up in the deep
nudged into the leg side
round the wicket, tight line, Head slashes a cut but can't beat cover
more of the same, cramped on the cut, with a well-set off-side field
slower through the air, and Head lost his shape as he stretched into a mow! Deflects backwards towards the stumps
'brilliant Joe!' says Buttler behind the stumps, tight line, no liberties allowed
pushed down the ground for a single to complete a probing over
flipped to leg from outside off, finds the gap behind square as Bairstow hurtles in from deep square. His shy hits the stumps but they decline the over-throw
crashed into the covers, and just short of cover! Morgan throws himself forward but can't get his fingers under the ball
worked to the leg side to get the scoreboard moving
outside off, good pace through to the keeper
a crunching drive into the covers, Morgan in business again as he fields a stinging shot
clipped firmly, with good timing, but straight to a deep-set mid-on
nurdled to leg
down on the sweep, can't get it away
delicate deflection, that will cheer the Aussies up. A very late late cut, and rushes to the rope
clipped to the leg side

Root has another! This is a killer spell! Head lost his head, charging down the pitch but beaten in the flight, a tame popped return catch, and Australia's innings has been blown wide open by the part-timer!
outside off, good length, met cautiously on the front foot

tucked to the leg side, they scamper back for the second and this is very tight... off come the bails at the very instant that Marsh slides his bat for the crease.. but he's just home, through benefit of doubt as much as anything. Close!
beats the edge, well bowled... in fact, there was bat on that but Buttler couldn't cling on
nudged back past the bowler
punched to the covers
leaning onto the front foot, solid defence
looped up, a hint of turn, worked with the spin into the leg side
wicket to wicket, nudged off the front pad, as far as short midwicket
down on one knee, swept hard but straight to short fine leg. Finch curses very loudly, as well he might
clipped to leg
on the pads once again, gathered at square leg
a rank full-toss, and a free hit coming up. He got away with a muffed pull to deep midwicket, but the pressure's on now...
a massive wind-up, but Root takes all the pace off the ball and there's no connection
outside off, back of a length, gathered in the covers. He's got out of that over with impressively little damage
tapped into the off side
flipped off the toes, gathered at short backward square
pushed onto the back foot, punched with intent down to long-on
beats the field at last! Makes some room, chops a cut through backward point
another roundhouse biff, but not properly connected
cracked off the back foot, down to wide long off
up onto the toes, cracked to cover
nudged to the leg side
short and wide, a rare bad one from Root, who is maybe losing his magic. Slapped hard through backward point
back on the straight and narrow, pushed back to the bowler from a full length
closes the face to work a single to long-on
tucked off the pads to square leg
hurried on a leg-stump line, defended off the back foot
on the back foot, blocked back down the pitch
nudged into the leg side
well bowled, wider on the crease, speared in on a full length
nothing to work with as Wood keeps it full and fast on middle and leg
a fraction short, and panned through square leg. A fine over is tarnished and Wood is furious with himself
clipped to the leg side
stretching onto the front foot, pushed into the covers
crashed through the covers, Root opted for the quicker ball, but Finch made room to cut from outside leg
round the wicket to tighten up the line
swept to backward square
forward and blocked
whipped off the toes, out to deep square leg and Finch pushes hard for the second
better line, but a sharp single, dropped into the off side on the back foot and an instant call
worked down the ground
short and sharp, good extra pace and bounce as Marsh is struck on the bicep as he climbs into a pull
that's a poor ball, but a fine diving stop from Rashid at fine leg to atone for the bowler. Angled down the leg and just helped on its way
good heat outside off, the length is the key as the ball skips through to Buttler
outside leg, and clipped straight to backward square
down the track, clipped to leg
hanging on the back foot, waiting for the ball to arrive, and punched through the off side
round the wicket, dabbed off the pads
nudged to the leg side, Root's leg-side line from round the wicket really limiting the freedom of the arms
down into position for the sweep, but can't connect. Safely outside the line so no appeal
attempted pull, but suckered by the slower ball. Scuttles through to the keeper
very full length, tapped to the off side, another pinched single
short and hauled out to deep midwicket
short, too short. Good aggression but there was no reaching that one
cracked down into the turf and up to backward point who intercepts with a leap
cracked into the leg side
worked off the pads
twirled up outside off, cracked into the covers
firmly swept, good relay work on the boundary's edge to cut off the four and get the ball back quickly
thumped into the leg side again, gathered at wide long-on
zipped through a touch flatter, patted to cover
biffed hard along the ground, back through the hands of the bowler, and gathered in the deep
worked into the off side
full at off stump, pushed straight of mid-on
a shorter delivery, he goes deep in the crease and knocks into the leg side
swing and a miss to a full ball outside off, the feet didn't really move
nicely bowled, a slower delivery, full and straight, defended with soft hands and it bobbles by his feet. Marsh intimates to pick the ball up, U-19 World Cup style. A few smiles around
pulled to long leg
a one-legged pull from outside off to deep square leg
pushes a full ball towards long-on
full, wider outside off, driven down to long-off
a googly, on off stump, goes for the sweep and finds short fine leg
that's a powerful sweep, fetches it and sends it along the ground through midwicket to bisect the men in the deep
more of a paddle-sweep this time, again finds short fine-leg
a shorter delivery, worked off the pads to deep square leg and he's on 97
full at off stump, held this back a touch at 123kph, pushed with a straight bat to midwicket
short of a length, angled into the pad, deflects off the thigh guard behind square
full and straight, punched firmly into the pitch and back to the bowler
a short ball, pulled through square leg
works this from well outside off into the leg side
back of a length, at off stump, another one with some pace off, pushed to backward point
short fine leg is a busy man, he cuts off another sweep from Finch
very full, at the toes, flicked to midwicket

back-to-back hundreds! A flatter, straighter, delivery, pushed out to deep square leg and he hustles back for the second. A reasonably restrained celebration. It's warm work out there and he knows Australia need more
plays forward and pushes to Rashid
gets the front foot across the crease and works a straight delivery towards square leg
plays back to a shorter delivery, guides it backward of point and the sweeper can't stop the second...brings up Australia's 200
a length ball outside off, chopped off the bottom edge into the crease
he's aiming into row Z with this one, has a huge wind up outside off at full delivery and doesn't make contact
full and straighter, worked off the pads deep into the leg side. Good running
slips this down the leg side, an angry cry from Plunkett
back outside off stump, short of a length, worked towards mid-on
doesn't connect cleanly, but gets the boundary to deep midwicket...short outside off, strongly pulled
back of a length outside off, Plunkett keeps the length short, bobbles off the face towards the keeper
hint of a leading edge about this as he shapes to play to the leg side
he's gone now! He knew he had to press the accelerator, he charges out of his crease, nowhere near the ball, has a swing across the line, misses and it's a simple stumping for Buttler
not sure he picked that googly, pushing forward and gets a thick inside edge to the leg side
nudges a shorter delivery towards midwicket, can't find the gap
swept from outside off to deep square
a delicate paddle-sweep, takes this from well wide of off stump, down to fine leg
finds mid-on! Once again, England strike back-to-back...went to drive down the ground, think he wanted to go over top, got no sort of elevation and it's a simple catch on the edge of the circle
short of a length outside off, quick adjustment of length to the new batsman, defended to backward point
a short ball over leg stump, he ducks to allow it through to the keeper
another wide down the leg side, he's had a few today, although that's a pretty tight call...not far from leg stump
tight run! Pushed into midwicket and that's a uncertain single
pushed into the covers
touch fuller, he hangs back in the crease and drives to deep cover...good over from Plunkett
full and straight, pushed back to the bowler
given caught behind! That's a lovely piece of bowling, England on the charge. Floated up on off stump, draws Stonis forward, spins away as he drives and it's a thin snick
slides off the face of the bat into backward point
swept from outside off to deep square
goes for the sweep, gets taken on the front pad
connects with this sweep, sends it behind square
full outside off, defended towards point
can't get this into a gap
another wide, full down the leg side
short of a length outside off, nicely timed square of the wicket but straight to point
fuller, at off stump, Carey gets forward and can only play it back to the bowler
swings across the line of a back-of-a-length delivery, out to deep square leg
full outside off, pushed into the on side, Root dives across from midwicket...another dot ball
beats him outside off with one that slides across him
gets across outside off and sweeps strongly behind square, excellent placement this time
he sweeps again, it's a slightly shorter delivery, and gets this one fine over the vacant short fine leg area...very nicely done
and now he reverse sweeps, goes very fine, just wide of the keeper...off the glove
this time White attempts the reverse, gets a bottom edge and Buttler does very well to stick a boot out...could have run away
sees this sliding down the leg side so leaves it alone and gets the extra ball
a googly outside off, cut to deep cover
back of a length, straight at 140kph, played to the leg side
full at leg stump, he moves to the leg side but can only tap this to the covers
a short ball, well-directed at off stump, he's through the pull and gets taken on the shoulder
and now he's full at the stumps, some pace off at 124kph, can't find a gap on the leg side
fuller still, at middle and leg, flicked to deep square
works a length delivery out to deep midwicket...a superb over, full of variation and skill, from Wood
goes for the reverse again, gets it wide of Buttler this time but can't beat short third man
another excellent shot from Carey, takes this from outside off and slog-sweeps wide of long-on
cuts this off the stumps straight to point but is able to steal the single
uses his feet, can't get to the pitch and pushes to cover
out of his crease again, this time he meets it on the full but it's only a single driven to long-off
that's magnificent! Touch of class about that, too full outside off, he drives in the air over cover and wide of long-off
gives himself a touch of room outside leg stump and drives strongly to the cover sweeper
a short delivery, into the pitch, he swipes to the leg side and gets a bottom edge
128kph, heaves a length ball into midwicket
moving to the leg side, Wood goes shorter, dragged to deep square leg...struggling to find the middle
a short delivery outside off, 142kph, beats the under edge as he goes for the pull
gets hold of this back-of-a-length delivery but finds deep midwicket
good length outside leg stump, worked off the pads to deep midwicket
goes right across the crease, tries to flick this away, does make contact, glances the pad through to Buttler...there's a query for lbw
this time he moves outside leg, goes too far, then can't reach a full delivery speared outside off

that's why England warm-up with football! Great skills from Woakes. Superb from him all-round, in fact. Firstly he out-smarted White with a slower-ball bouncer which was bottom edged into the crease, Carey came through for the run, Woakes followed through and right-footed into the stumps
good length at the pads, misses his flick and gets taken on the pads. Another dot
back of a length, straight, pushed to the covers
this one is crunched, one bounce to deep square leg
shorter on the hip, flicked to fine leg
back of a length into the pitch, White almost swinging himself off his feet, only a single as he pulls to deep midwicket
goes fuller, at the stumps, squeezed out through the leg side and deep square stops the second
wide outside off, White swings and gets a toe end down the ground

dropped at deep midwicket by Root! Did he lose it in the sun? Got into a horrible tangle. Short of a length, swung strongly, almost straight down Root's throat and he palms it down. Still, only a single
this time he's taken at deep midwicket! Roy this time. Good length, bit of pace off, Starc tries to clear the leg side and can't get the distance needed
full and straight, superb, driven to mid-on
short of a length, connects cleanly as he swings this out to deep midwicket
a bouncer, beats him over the top edge as he goes for the pull
gets this over the rope! It's a low full toss, he uses his power and thumps it over wide long-on

direct hit! Dot ball and a wicket to end. Woakes goes short, Tye bottom edges into the crease, they go for the run, Woakes is quickly on it in his follow through then spins around and hits direct at the non-striker's end
outside off, shades of swing, left alone with a flourish
swing again, shaping into the right-hander's pads, deflected fine
better line, bending into middle and off, and forcefully defended on the front foot

flicked off the toes, and scooped up at short midwicket! It was the swing wot won it, aiming straight, looking for the lbw, Roy's bat came swishing across the line but couldn't stay on top of the shot. A good low grab from Finch to lift Australia's spirits
full and straight, dug out on the crease with caution
outside off, good aggressive line, left alone
outswing on a full length, encouraging pace
sharp again, ducking into the right hander, and pushed to the leg side off the back foot
full length, outswing, read early and Bairstow's supreme timing comes to the fore to pierce the covers with quick hands
jeepers, how did that miss! Fast and full, and Bairstow was beaten for pace, under-edging a defensive push off the toe of his bat and past the off stump!
forward again, this is genuinely brisk from Richardson, skidding low from a low trajectory
punched off the back foot to mid-off. A very fine first over from the new boy
a long-levered drive into the covers, smothered with a dive
short, and pumped with firm forearms through midwicket. That sat up and begged
dabbed to cover
a loose full toss outside off. That's a rank delivery from a fine bowler, and Hales picks his spot, behind square on the off side, with a dismissive slap
better areas, full and straight with a hint of inswing, but Hales taps and goes, teasing mid-off with a cheeky single
width, and steered to point with loose hands
met on the front foot and pushed to cover
brisk again, 144.6kph, met on the back foot with a cautious jab
drilled to cover, another sharp single to Warner who shies at the non-striker's stumps but to no avail
full and straight, cautious defence on the back foot
full again and firmly spanked back down the pitch, but Richardson drops his hands on the ball to intercept
outside off, and jabbed to point
too wide again from Starc, and Hales just uses the pace to glide a cut past point
on the back foot, defended with a hop
short, and wafted out to deep midwicket, looks as though he opted against a full-blooded mow, with the man back on the rope
too short, too wide. Starc is not getting it right often enough in this spell, and Bairstow batters a cut through point. No swing back into the right-hander, so the wider line is a freebie
that's sublime. Fuller length, tighter line, drilled through the covers

sharp bouncer and that's cracked Bairstow on the side of the grille like a right hook! He's fine, the lid does its job as the ball bobbles into the gully. Actually, it looked like the breastbone on second viewing.
tight line, defended
worked into the off side
tight line, solid defence
clobbered through the covers! Pace, but no movement, and the faster it hits the bat, the faster it comes off...
outside off, steered down to third man
guided to midwicket with a roll of the wrists
round the wicket, too short, too wide, pumped through point. Not a good start
round the wicket, aping Root's line on leg stump, and duly defended
tapped into the off side
swept supremely! Looping onto a middle and leg line, and clumped on the up, over backward square. Played entirely on length
punched with high elbows to mid-on, thoughts of a second, but not this time
forward, and pushed to mid-off
tidy line and length
blocked on a middle and leg line, angled into the right hander on a full length
good areas once again, bending into the top of the stumps as Hales attempts a squeeze through third man
on the back foot, poked to cover
defended back down the line of the ball. Good tight restrictive line
over-ptiched and clouted along the ground, through the covers! Excellent opportunistic batting, waiting for the error and cashing in with aplomb!
a big appeal but Bairstow is so far down the track that it is guesswork... Smith declines the review, though it might have been tight...
swept square
another sweep, finer on this occasion, but it was way outside leg and a no-risk opportunity for the batsman to have a swing
pumped in the air, past the diving bowler
forward and worked out to point
eased into the gap to keep the strike
eased into the off side
good change of pace, Bairstow has to adjust late in order to time his defensive push
banged in short and straight, through to the keeper who gives a tap of applause as he gathers
worked into the off side once more
too short, crashed on the up through backward point. England are doling out the lessons with every error in length
fuller and straighter, blocked this time
over the wicket this time, tapped out past the diving short cover
looped up and dipping outside off, flogged with lots of bottom hand into the leg side
back of a length, stabbed past short midwicket who half-stops with a dive
that is utterly panned, another nailed sweep out through square leg
flicked into the leg side
leaning onto the front foot to defend
another tight line to Bairstow who squares up in defence
a crazy miscue from Bairstow, suckered by the slower ball, and somehow middled a checked shot, high up and over the cover ring, and almost all the way to the boundary
short and aggressive. Too short...
a glided drive out to point
on the back foot, worked to the leg side
too short, too wide, too repetitive from Australia's quicks. Interspersing excellent deliveries with rank long-hops, and England are cruising at the moment
fuller, straighter, punched to cover
worked into the gap, too wide to be a threat
punched into the covers
short, and hauled over midwicket with all the time in the world
eased out to cover
better ball, leaning forward to defend
angled bat, out to midwicket. A curate's egg of an over
short, a short-arm pull out to midwicket
short again, pulled down and across, rolling the wrists to control the stroke
opens the face, guides out to point
outside off, an edge, but perfectly safe with no cordon... but hang on, there's a shy from third man and the bails are off... nope... just made it home
solidly forward, poked to point
nudged into the leg side, another pilfered single
round the wicket, glided out to point
punched back to the bowler
eased on the up, into the gap at midwicket
on the back foot, middle and leg line, pushed off the back foot
well bowled, a teasing line on middle, defended
flicked urgently to midwicket, and just two from the over. Good control from Finch
on the back foot, worked to the leg side
too short again, pumped along the ground to the midwicket sweeper
defended on the back foot, out to midwicket
solidly into line
short and pulled again out through square leg
battered down the ground, a one-bounce four, and that is an outstanding initiative-seizing fifty for Bairstow. And it's the hundred up as well
easy levers from Hales, a mighty wallop up and over long-on, and there is his fifty as well!
good length this time, drawn onto the front foot to block
solidly forward, almost stereotypically diligent in defence
eased into the off side
punched to cover
big appeal, but sliding down on the angle
wide outside off, cut to deep cover
very full this time, jabbed to backward point with an open face
short on leg stump, he rolls his wrists and pulls to long leg...and there's his pace between the wickets, Bairstow makes that into a second. Always pushing
he drags this a little, drives at a fullish delivery, the bat face twists and it's in the air but straight of mid-on
full outside off, opens the face and runs to third man
gets over the top of this short one and pulls through square leg
full outside off, beats the inside edge as he plays a slightly loose prod
short of a length outside off, angled to third man
finds backward point
a bouncer over off stump, left alone
back of a length, a short-arm jab out to deep midwicket
flips a short ball down towards long leg, not a million miles from carrying but safe in the end
a good short ball, well-directed over middle stump, follows Hales a little as he sways out of the line
dragged on! A first ODI wicket for Richardson. Short of a length, looking to run it down to third man and gets an under edge into the stumps
good length outside off, left alone
touch fuller, starts outside off and shapes back a touch, 142kph, defended to cover
tight line and length, back of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
fuller outside off, driven square to point...Richardson returns with a wicket maiden
he's through his pull shot a little early, skids under the bottom edge
a very short bouncer this time, loops over Bairstow's head. Called wide
connects with the pull this time, places it behind square
keeps it short, Bairstow takes a blow on the shoulder as he attempts another pull...the ball bobbles towards backward point
full outside off, gets forward and plays to cover
short of a length, pushed off the back foot to point
full outside off, drives to deep cover
that's a wonderful piece of timing and placement, takes advantage of a hint of width and drives between cover and backward point
very similar shot, driven off the back foot, deep point has gone out
finds cover! Back-to-back wickets for Richardson. Full outside off, he goes for the drive, neither keeps it down or goes fully over the top, picks out Warner
gets an inside edge on a good length ball, this is good stuff from Richardson
angled across outside off, left alone
good length at middle and leg, pushed into the leg side from the inside part of the bat
round the wicket, pushed towards point and that's a scampered single
just wide of backward point! Width from Head, Morgan goes for the cut, goes in the air but fine of the diving fielder - Warner
fuller, at off stump, defended
too short, he rocks back deep in his crease and pulls over midwicket
back on a good length, defended
pushes through a little quick, played off the back foot to the bowler
back of a length outside off, driven to deep point
just short of a length on the hip, he flip-pulls it high over deep backward square leg. Sweet timing
good length, defended
very full, just outside off, jabbed back to the bowler
full and straight, defended to the bowler
on the pads, loops in the air as Morgan pushes to the leg side but short of mid-on
round the wicket, full at leg stump, he plays forward
shorter outside off, he drives through the covers off the back foot wide of the sweeper
on the stumps, blocked
full and straight, defended
leans forward, takes the inside edge to the leg side
bunted down the ground to long-on
good length outside off, angled to backward point
width outside off, he leans back and square drives to deep point
back of a length at off stump, 142kph, defended to cover
full and straight, driven back to the bowler
full, width outside off, he square drives behind point, not quite perfectly timed and third man gets around
back at the stumps, full length, driven to mid-off
full and straight, worked through midwicket
good length outside off, driven to cover
gets a leading edge towards mid-off as he tries to work a straight ball to the leg side
full and straight, driven towards mid-on
a slower ball, comes out as a full toss which is driven to deep cover...ruled to be under waist height
full and straight, flicked through midwicket
he's done it! Via the inside edge. Game on? A good length ball, just angling into Morgan, playing forward, gets an inside edge into his pad then into the stumps
greets Buttler with a bouncer which he ducks underneath
full outside off, pushed into the covers and he sprints through to get off the mark
back of a length at off stump, played to the on side
shorter, outside leg stump, shoveled around the corner with his bottom hand coming off the bat
short at leg stump, he ducks
worked off the pads through square leg
full outside off, driven to deep cover
full, wide outside off, Buttler reaches out for it and drives to the sweeper
good length, pushed to mid-off
goes full and straight, clipped to long leg
full at off stump, a firm drive finds mid-off...good little period for Australia
good length outside off, pushed to cover
fuller, he gets forward and drives to deep cover
back of a length, straight, defended to the leg side
there's the short one, Buttler pulls through midwicket
short again, on the hip, worked down to long leg
another short one, a slower bouncer, Root pulls to deep midwicket
short of a length outside off, angled to third man
full and straight, strongly flicked towards midwicket who is annoyed with himself that he can't prevent it escaping for a single
tucks a straight delivery off the pads through midwicket...under 100 needed
short and that's superb placement, gets it quickly to ground - didn't bounce very high - and sends it wide of long leg
goes fuller, at off stump, flicked to the on side
goes for another pull, was outside off this time and it beats him under the bottom edge
good length at off stump, defended to cover
a touch fuller, Root whips a straight delivery through midwicket
fuller, driven back to the bowler
wide on the crease, full at off stump, dug out to backward point
pushes a full delivery to cover who is quite close
another full one finds cover...an excellent over from the impressive Richardson
that's a way to greet the returning bowler! Pumps a full delivery over mid-off
drags the length, angled in the pads
full and straight, this stroke is a little more ungainly as he heaves across the line through midwicket
short outside off, left alone
gets some fortune here! Pulls this short delivery and it flies off the top edge over the keeper
another short one, he opts for caution this time and sways out of the line
full and straight, slips into the pads, clipped fine
again he's flicking a full, straight delivery, this time it goes squarer
clipped off the pads to long leg
short of a length, pushed down the leg side
short outside off, left alone
the bottom hand takes over as he fetches this from well outside to deep square
and there's a bit more of Buttler, come over to my side again, swings a full delivery high over midwicket and wide of mid-on
keeps a touch low on off stump, flicked off the back foot to midwicket
flicked into the leg side once more
open-faced drive into the covers, well pounced by White
a closed-faced steer down to long-on
battered through the gap at midwicket! Oodles of bottom hand swinging through the line to take any threat of a fielder out of the equation. England keep marching on
onto the front foot, eased into the covers
round the wicket, very full length outside off, chopped down through third man
forward and drilled to cover
very full length, round the wicket, squeezed into the covers
short, and picked up so early, a roundhouse pull out to deep midwicket
eased into the covers once more
chipped, ever so briefly, in the air and through the covers
striding onto the front foot and worked down to long-on
outside off, chopped through point
on the pads again, flicked to leg
on the back foot, clubbed down to long-on
big stride, full swing of the blade, solid contact into the covers
down the leg side
edged and gone! Through to the keeper, easy as pie. That's a superb ball in any circumstance. Angled in, nipping away, drawing the thin edge. A glimmer
tapped into the covers, a quick single to get the account open
Starc is settling into an ominous rhythm now, round the wicket, very full, every ball a bullet. But he's got just three balls left...
there it goes! This is brilliant from Starc ... so full, so quick, late movement with reverse into the toes. Moeen's timbers are rattled and, well, he's not given up the ghost yet!
full once again, from round the wicket, but Woakes is equal to the task this time. Props forward to shut the door
punched into the covers, Woakes is off the mark, and Starc's spell is done. Took some tap from Bairstow and Hales but his wicket-taking has kept Australia's fingertips in the contest
slower ball, tapped back down the pitch
outside off, a hint of inswing, but kept out with hasty adjustment
worked into the gap once more, singles will suffice for England
looking for the single as Root drops the ball as his feet, but Australia's close fielders swoop
nibble off the seam again, reverse swing and extra bounce. It's getting tricky out there now... but Australia's quicks are running out of overs
eased into the covers, that's a good riposte, head over the ball and finding enough of a gap to relieve the pressure
angled bat, defended out to point
stand and swat. Woakes has a mow from his stance, but inside-edges into the leg side, beaten by a hint of late inswing. Good bowling
fuller length, driven to short cover
a sharp shy from Smith in the covers, but to no avail
tailing back into the stumps, and that's a very fine open-faced drive into the gap in the covers. Goes all the way and that changes things
superb from Woakes! Hanging on the back foot, sensing the adjustment in length after a fractional over-pitch, and sure enough, he dumps Richardson's next ball over cow corner to wreck the over's work
chopped firmly to backward point
cut into the off side
crunched into the covers
eased to the off side
on the back foot, tucked to leg
over-pitched, and Woakes once again produces an admirable shot in the circumstances, an open-faced steer into the gap at extra cover. It's almost done here, you sense...
short, an uncertain pull, but safely placed into no-man's land at midwicket
dead-batted defence, down into the crease. And another sharp single
angled defence back down the pitch
blocked on a full length
back of a length, pulled round the corner and ... whoops, that's a tremendous blooper from Stoinis, who slides, attempts to gather, lets the ball elude his grasp, and watches it trickle over the rope
outside off, and an attempted thrash through the covers
on the pads, clipped through the leg side
back of a length, pumped down the ground with a cross-batted mow, takes a bit of a top edge  but eludes the field
short, and slammed! A brilliant pull, going from high to low, nailed clean through square leg to reduce the requirement to 11
open the face, angle the shot, down to third man
defended into the off side
on the back foot, glided into the off side
full length, attempted drill back past the bowler, but not quite timed
short and through midwicket
solid defence, back down the track
back foot block, pushed to cover
on the pads, attempted flick, can't get this one through
up and over the covers, a shackle-breaking slap to reduce the requirement to within a single blow
up and over point, leaning back and timing the pants off his uppercut! Scores are level...
pumped up and over long-on, plugs in the deep, trickles to the rope, and England have secured a tremendous win
